    public interface PolicyPeriod
extends InvoicingOverridable, com.guidewire.bc.domain.account.gen.PolicyPeriodStubI, DelinquencyTarget
    PolicyPeriod A policy over a single policy period

      Deprecated. 
      (Since 8.0.0) PolicyPeriod has no unapplied t-accounts, so invoking this method on an object that is known to be a PolicyPeriod is somewhat suspect. To avoid this deprecation warning, upcast the PolicyPeriod object to a TAccountOwner before invoking this method.

    • Method Detail

      • releaseFinalAuditHold

        void releaseFinalAuditHold()
        This will release all charges which are held to wait for the final audit to complete. Charge holds usually happen when the policy period is currently cancelled or being cancelled and is waiting for final audit.

      • waiveFinalAudit

        void waiveFinalAudit()
        Waive scheduled final audit on this policy period.

      • scheduleFinalAudit

        void scheduleFinalAudit()
        Schedule a final audit for this policy period.

      • getTotalValueExcludingRollups

        MonetaryAmount getTotalValueExcludingRollups()
        For an open policy this will return the same value as the TAccountOwner.getTotalValue(). After a policy is closed the total value is zero, so this method will return the sum amount of all charge revenue rollup transactions.
        Returns:
        the sum amount of all charge revenue rollup transactions

      • getChargeRevenueRollupSum

        earned premium amount

      • getEarnedExcludingRollups

        MonetaryAmount getEarnedExcludingRollups()
        Returns:
        the sum of all earned t-accounts in all pro-rata and pass-through charges. If it's not pro-rata than entire amount is earned.

      • addHold

        TroubleTicket addHold(HoldType[] holdTypes)
        Adds a hold to this account using the specified hold types. Creates a trouble ticket to manage the holds, and returns the created trouble ticket.
        Returns:
        the created trouble ticket

      • addHoldAndTroubleTicket

        void addHoldAndTroubleTicket(HoldType[] holdTypes,
                           TroubleTicket troubleTicket)
        Adds a hold to this policy period using the specified hold types. Puts the holds on the given trouble ticket, which is linked to this policy period

      • releaseHold

        void releaseHold(HoldType[] holdTypes)
        Removes the specified hold types from the hold on the policy period. Closes the associated trouble ticket if there are no more holdtypes on the trouble ticket. Does nothing if the account doesn't have any open trouble tickets.

        Returns:

        Whether this PolicyPeriod's BillingMethod is Agency Bill.

      • refactorInvoiceItemsToPaymentPlan

        @Deprecated
void refactorInvoiceItemsToPaymentPlan(PaymentPlan newPaymentPlan,
                                                boolean refactorAllInvoiceItems)
        Deprecated. (Since 8.0.0) - Use the PaymentPlanChanger class to initialize, preview, and execute a Payment Plan Change.
        Converts the invoice items gathered from each charge associated with this policy period, to use the new payment plan. The refactor all invoice items parameter is used to determine whether or not we can convert non planned invoice items.

        REDISTRIBUTE PAYMENTS Same as calling {#refactorInvoiceItemsToPaymentPlan(newPaymentPlan, refactorAllInvoiceItems, TRUE)}

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getUnappliedAmount

        @Deprecated
MonetaryAmount getUnappliedAmount()
        Deprecated. (Since 8.0.0) PolicyPeriod has no unapplied t-accounts, so invoking this method on an object that is known to be a PolicyPeriod is somewhat suspect. To avoid this deprecation warning, upcast the PolicyPeriod object to a TAccountOwner before invoking this method.
        PolicyPeriod has no unapplied t-account so this method always returns zero.
        Specified by:
        getUnappliedAmount in interface TAccountOwner

      • getChargeAmount

        MonetaryAmount getChargeAmount(ChargePattern chargePattern)
        Gets the total value of the charge for this policy.

      • getChargePaidAmount

        MonetaryAmount getChargePaidAmount(ChargePattern chargePattern)
        Gets the amount of the charge paid.

      • getChargeOutstandingAmount

        MonetaryAmount getChargeOutstandingAmount(ChargePattern chargePattern)
        Gets the amount of the charge outstanding. This is defined as the sum balance of the charge's due and billed t-accounts.

      • getChargeRemainingBalance

        MonetaryAmount getChargeRemainingBalance(ChargePattern chargePattern)
        The sum of the charge's unbilled, billed, and due t-account balances. Alternatively, the total charge value minus payments applied.

      • getDepositAmount

        MonetaryAmount getDepositAmount(ChargePattern chargePattern)
        Parameters:
        chargePattern - The charge pattern on which we want to restrict our search for deposit invoice items

      • getUnbilledTxAmount

        MonetaryAmount getUnbilledTxAmount(Transaction transaction)
        Returns the signed amount of a single line item, on the transaction, satisfying the following criteria:
        1. The T-account of the line item is found in the PolicyPeriod's unbilled T-accounts set
        2. The T-account is owned by the given T-account owner.

        Notes:

        • The T-accounts should be mutually exclusive for this transaction; i.e., it is an error if the transaction has multiple line items satisfying the above criteria.
        • This method returns a single line item's signed value, not a sum.
        Parameters:
        transaction - The transaction to examine
        Returns:
        Signed amount of the matching line item or zero if no matching line item was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is more than one matching line item on the transaction.

      • getBilledTxAmount

        MonetaryAmount getBilledTxAmount(Transaction transaction)
        Returns the signed amount of a single line item, on the transaction, satisfying the following criteria:
        1. The T-account of the line item is found in the PolicyPeriod's Billed T-accounts set
        2. The T-account is owned by the given T-account owner.

        Notes:

        • The T-accounts should be mutually exclusive for this transaction; i.e., it is an error if the transaction has multiple line items satisfying the above criteria.
        • This method returns a single line item's signed value, not a sum
        Parameters:
        transaction - The transaction to examine
        Returns:
        Signed amount of the matching line item or zero if no matching line item was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is more than one matching line item on the transaction.

      • getDueTxAmount

        MonetaryAmount getDueTxAmount(Transaction transaction)
        Returns the signed amount of a single line item, on the transaction, satisfying the following criteria:
        1. The T-account of the line item is found in the PolicyPeriod's Due T-accounts set
        2. The T-account is owned by the given T-account owner.

        Notes:

        • The T-accounts should be mutually exclusive for this transaction; i.e., it is an error if the transaction has multiple line items satisfying the above criteria.
        • This method returns a single line item's signed value, not a sum
        Parameters:
        transaction - The transaction to examine
        Returns:
        Signed amount of the matching line item or zero if no matching line item was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is more than one matching line item on the transaction.

      • getPaidTxAmount

        MonetaryAmount getPaidTxAmount(Transaction transaction)
        Returns the negated total amount of the Unbilled, Billed, and Due line items for this transaction. This is considered the total amount paid towards this transaction.
        Parameters:
        transaction - The transaction to examine
        Returns:
        The sum of UnbilledTxAmount, BilledTxAmount, and DueTxAmount, then negated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is more than one matching line item on the transaction for any of the source amounts.

      • getPaidThroughDate

        java.util.Date getPaidThroughDate()
        Returns:
        the date through which this policy is paid, calculated as the date on which Paid Amount intersects the Earned Amount curve (usually the same as the Earned Premium curve but depends on Charge.IncludedInEquityDating).

      • getPaidThroughDate

        java.util.Date getPaidThroughDate(MonetaryAmount amount)
        Parameters:
        amount - the given amount
        Returns:
        the date through which this policy is paid, calculated as the date on which the given amount intersects the Earned Amount curve (usually the same as the Earned Premium curve but depends on Charge.IncludedInEquityDating).

      • getEarnedAmount

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getPolicyEquity

        MonetaryAmount getPolicyEquity()
        Returns:
        the policy equity, calculated as the paid amount of relevant charges minus the earned amount. Relevant charges are defined by Charge.IncludedInEquityDating

      • changeBillingMethodToDirectBill

        void changeBillingMethodToDirectBill(boolean createInvoiceForToday,
                                   ReversePaymentsWhenMovingInvoiceItem reversePayments)
        Changes the Billing Method from Agency Bill or List Bill to Direct Bill.

        It will try to make it appear as if the original policy period was Direct Bill to begin with and deal with reallocating commissions, moving invoice items, etc.

        Parameters:
        reversePayments - Whether or not we should reverse payments on the invoice items on this policy period as we change their payer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this PolicyPeriod is already Direct Bill @param createInvoiceForToday

      • changeBillingMethodToAgencyBill

        void changeBillingMethodToAgencyBill(ReversePaymentsWhenMovingInvoiceItem reversePayments)
        Changes the Billing Method from Direct Bill or List Bill to Agency Bill.

        It will try to make it appear as if the original policy period was Agency Bill to begin with and deal with reallocating commissions, moving invoice items, etc.

        Parameters:
        reversePayments - Whether or not we should reverse payments on the invoice items on this policy period as we change their payer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this PolicyPeriod is already Agency Bill

      • changeBillingMethodToListBill

        void changeBillingMethodToListBill(Account listBillAccount,
                                 PaymentPlan paymentPlan,
                                 InvoiceStream invoiceStream,
                                 boolean movePlannedInvoicesOnly,
                                 ReversePaymentsWhenMovingInvoiceItem reversePayments,
                                 boolean redistributePayments)
        Changes the billing method of a PolicyPeriod to List Bill, or modifies the billing details of a PolicyPeriod that is already ListBill.

        It will try to make it appear as if the original policy period was List Bill to begin with and deal with reallocating commissions, moving invoice items, etc.

        Parameters:
        listBillAccount - the ListBill Account which will be the payer
        paymentPlan - the PaymentPlan to be used
        invoiceStream - the InvoiceStream to be used
        movePlannedInvoicesOnly - If true, move only the planned invoices to the new payer. Otherwise, move all the invoices to the new payer. The default is false.
        reversePayments - Whether or not we should reverse payments on the invoice items on this policy period as we change their payer
        redistributePayments - If true, redistribute and reverse affected payment items. Otherwise, reverse affected payment items but do not redistribute them.

        java.util.Collection<Invoice> getInvoices()
        Returns all of the invoices associated with the Policy Period.

      • getPolicyCommissionHistoryForRole

        PolicyCommissionHistoryEntry[] getPolicyCommissionHistoryForRole(PolicyRole role)
        Gets the list of all PolicyCommissions that have had the given role on this policy period as a default PolicyCommission. Results are ordered by end date descending. Note that the return value will contain nulls to indicate gaps in the history. If no producer code has ever occupied this role, returns an empty array.

      • getDefaultPolicyCommissionForRole

        PolicyCommission getDefaultPolicyCommissionForRole(PolicyRole role)
        Gets the default PolicyCommission for the given role.

      • getDefaultProducerCodeForRole

        Gets the producer code in the given role.

      • getDefaultRolesForProducerCode

        PolicyRole[] getDefaultRolesForProducerCode(ProducerCode producerCode)
        Gets the roles occupied by the given producer code on this policy.

      • getDefaultPolicyCommissionsForAllRoles

        java.util.List<PolicyCommission> getDefaultPolicyCommissionsForAllRoles()
        Gets all the default PolicyCommissions for this policy.

      • getActivePolicyCommissionsForAllRoles

        java.util.List<PolicyCommission> getActivePolicyCommissionsForAllRoles()
        Returns all of this policy's PolicyCommissions that are still active (have null end dates).

      • getAllPolicyCommissions

        PolicyCommission[] getAllPolicyCommissions()
        Gets all the PolicyCommissions for this policy. Result includes non-current PolicyCommissions (i.e., those that formerly were associated with this policy, but whose responsibilities were transferred to another producer code), so this method should be used with caution.

      • getProducerCodeRoleEntries

        ProducerCodeRoleEntry[] getProducerCodeRoleEntries()
        Returns an array of ProducerCodeRoleEntries, used by the UI to set producer codes by role. Each entry returned is initialized to the existing PolicyRoles on the Policy.

        Returns all the PolicyPeriod's items' invoices whose status is Billed or Due. Returns the invoices from oldest to newest
        Returns:
        array of Invoices
